meanings.definition: To drag or pull something faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outdragging the other animals in the race.
meanings.sent2: She always outdrags her friends when they play tug-of-war.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outdragging the snail in their slow race.
meanings.sent4: The wind outdrags any human in a footrace.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outdrags any other vehicle on the road.

meanings.definition: To surpass in dragging or pulling.
meanings.sent1: The determined ant outdrags the larger insects in moving food.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outdrag the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent3: The little tugboat outdrags the big ship in the harbor.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outdrags any obstacle in her way.
meanings.sent5: The tiny ant outdrags the mighty elephant in pulling weight.

meanings.definition: The act of dragging or pulling something faster than others.
meanings.sent1: His outdragging of the sled impressed everyone at the competition.
meanings.sent2: The team's outdragging of the opponents secured their victory.
meanings.sent3: The snail's outdragging of the turtle caused quite a stir in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The car's outdragging of the train was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The horse's outdragging of the carriage was a remarkable feat.
